chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle
Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Sonnentag was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).
  • Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from defendant's attorney

Defendant, Michael D Sonnentag, in custody, appeared with Attorney Harry R Hertel.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D. Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:38) 
State - addresses the court - State received information from civil attorney regarding civil law suit and payments made by insurance company - tried to follow up on the amounts it covered, she did not hear back until end of last week - counsel had worked out an agreement based on amounts they could calculate $38,509.30 plus 10% surcharge - totalling $42,360.23
Hartel - that is the agreed amount with an immediate payment of $20,000 from the bond wasn't sure if the 10% surcharge would be calculated after the $20,000 was paid
State calls L.R. - sworn - asking to help with two funeral bills, repay air fares, bringing two people back to Phillipines, funeral lots for each, lost wages, lost valuables, attorney fees $112,538.35 not including the vehicle
State marks Exh 1 - itemization of costs - received
Cross by Hertel
Hertel offers Exh 2 - stipulation of counsel - received
Redirect by State
Witness excused
Court questions Ms. Lande about crime victim compensation program for victims
Hertel - addresses the fact that if the deft doesn't pay the victims - the crime victim compensation program gets involved and the deft would reimburse the force - wants the full $20,000 to go to the victims family and not the Illinios atty
State - would much rather have the court make a decision today rather then make the victims come back again
Hertel - would prefer the court make a decision today
State - argues - any wages that Mr. Sonnentag earns should go to restitution
Hertel - argues

COURT:  $20,000 bond amount goes toward restitution - no attorneys fees are to come out of it
would counsel want the matter continued a short period for Ms. Lande to get figures together
will go over documents and give written order in couple weeks
from Hertel Law Office requesting hearing be removed as Stipulation circulating
list of no contacts

(1:43)  State argues sentencing - requests lengthy incarceration - recommends that the court not treat each crime as one - recommends 10 yrs prison with 5 yrs IC 5 yrs ES on each count - cc - restitution hearing be scheduled - no contact with victims - DNA - no alcohol upon release, Rest $345,000 but does not include civil settlement
(2:07)  Hertel argues sentence - valid reason to consider deft's developmental disability - on Ct 1, 6-8 yrs prison with 3-4 yrs IC and 3-4 yrs ES - on Ct 2 consecutive imposed and stayed sentence, impose 10 yrs IC and 10 yrs ES and stay that and place on 20 yrs probation - AODA assess & follow thru - community service 300 hrs over ES, talk to high schools, youth groups - DNA & surcharge - restitution hearing to review restitution 
(2:33)  Michael Sonnentag addresses the court 

(2:36)  Court addresses sentencing
(2:55)  DECISION:  
Ct 1 - $268 cc, $250 dna surchg, 10 yrs total confinement - 6 yrs IC 4 yrs ES

Ct 2 - $268 cc, $250 dna surchg, 10 yrs total confinement - 6 yrs IC 4 yrs ES
Concurrent
Credit 95 days

CONDITIONS:  DNA sample, 
voting prohibition ordered, firearm prohibition ordered, restitution $345,000, prohibited from possessing any armour
Victim Rights complied with - not eligible for challenge incarceration or substance abuse - no contact with anyone who testified today in court a list to be provided with d.o.b.
AODA assess. No alcohol. not ordering comm service.  Restorative justice as DOC agent and families wish to have.

Defendant, Michael D Sonnentag with Attorney Harry R. Hertel appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron Olson.  Kim Silvius - Clerk

Information filed

State - addresses the court on bond, right side of proxy wasn't filled out - total score should of shown 4 rather then 0 - blood alcohol indicates .146 - requests sober link placed to do 4 breath tests a day
Hertel - he's on a no drink, all alcohol was removed from home, he works with his father, he could report for PBT's
Hertel - have a date Dec 8 to inspect the vehicles

understands proxy and not certain whether they are accurately filled out - satisfied with the Courts decision on bond with no drink provision is sufficient, confident the community is protected - bond continues
